_source.company_public_response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

_source.product: Debt collection
_source.complaint_what_happened:
Wakefield and Associates, a national debt collector, is attempting to collect on a debt that should have never been sent to collections. The original creditor is XXXX XXXX and the debt is associated with another debt that has been processed and accepted by XXXX, an insurance company. 
The alleged debt is about {$3000.00} and is a charge related to a data contract that arises from and is associated with another XXXX XXXX transaction in the amount of {$4000.00} for four devices and on months service with late fees ( two phones for {$680.00} each, two tablets for {$760.00} each and one hotspot device for {$85.00} ). The telephone numbers and corresponding insurance claim numbers associated with each device are XXXX claim number XXXX for an XXXX, XXXX claim number XXXX for an XXXX, XXXX claim number XXXX for an XXXX, XXXX claim number XXXX for an XXXX, and XXXX XXXX forwarded to collections. 
It should also be noted that such cancelation was requested within 24 hours of the date of the data contract and I already had a data plan and device in place at the time of the contract and requested cancelation. 
In resolution of this matter, I would like this collection account to be removed from all credit reporting agencies. I would also like this CFPB complaint to be sent to the appropriate State and federal regulatory agencies for a thorough and complete investigation to determine if this practice and type of behavior by the companies involved is the norm as a matter of ordinary business practices.
_source.issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed

_source.product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
_source.complaint_what_happened:
I made a money wire via my XXXX credit card for XXXX $ to a friend in XXXX using Western Union via their website- I opened an account for myself with them today just before this transaction 2 transactions were charged on my card instead on the single one I made. 
My bank thankfully caught that and cancelled the second fraudulent one. 
Western Union was showing both in their system as they were made by me. I had them cancel my account for safety.
